--TYPOGRAPHY--

If you need italicize style use class 'ital'

If you need bold style use class 'bold'

--Transformation styling--

If you need capitalize your text use class 'capit'

If you need uppercase your text use class 'up'

If you need lowercase your text use class 'low'

If you need to indicate that the text is a short fragment of computer code like this: querySellector() use class 'code'.

If you need to indicate that the text is a citation like this: All that glitters is not gold use class 'cite'.

--text decoration styling--

If you need underline your text like this: Brevity is the soul of wit use class 'line'.

If you need underline your text like this: If music be the food of love, play on. use class 'underline'.

--FONT SIZES styling--

for big zise titles use class="font-1"

5rem (80px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit

for middium size titles use class="font-2"

3rem (48px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur

for small size titles use class="font-3"

1.5rem (24px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

for small size titles use class="font-4"

1.25rem (20px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

for small size titles use class="font-5"

1rem (16px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

for small size titles use class="font-6"

.875rem (14px)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.

--QUOTES--

Use :
- class "blockquate" for parent element (< blockquote >) to style quote the way presented below.
- class "blockquate-p" for child elemepnt (paragraph < p > )
- class "blockquate-c" for child elemepnt (< cite > )
- add desired typeface by adding one of the typefaces classses (check the TYPE_FACE section).
In example below we used class="helvetica" for paragraph < p >

‘Life’s but a walking shadow, a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more; it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.’

―William Shakespeare 

         <blockquote class="helvetica blockquate">
           <p class="blockquate-p">
            ‘Life’s but a walking shadow, a poor player, that struts and frets his
            hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more; it is a tale told by
            an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.’
           </p>
           <cite class="blockquate-c">―William Shakespeare </cite>
         </blockquote>
